intro: Glycine hispida var. virescens-virescens, commonly known as the green-hairy nightshade, is a variant of the hairy nightshade plant. It is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. The plant features hairy, ovate leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are typically berries that turn red when mature. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in herbal medicine.
